chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 59-year-old female with suspected drug-induced acute hepatitis from losartan. Lab results show peak ALT of 640 IU/L, peak AST of 341 IU/L, peak ALP of 344 IU/L (increased from 247 IU/L at initial presentation to 344 IU/L at 2-week follow-up), GGT not mentioned, total bilirubin peak of 5.5 μmol/L and direct bilirubin peak of 3.0 μmol/L, INR normal (not specified but mentioned as normal), albumin normal (not specified but mentioned as normal). Clinical outcome is improved/discharged with complete normalization of liver enzymes within 1 month and sustained recovery at 6 months.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin: 5.5 μmol/L, Direct bilirubin: 3.0 μmol/L
